properties.headline: Avalanche Warning issued February 6 at 10:25AM MST by NWS Pocatello ID
properties.description:
THE FOLLOWING MESSAGE IS TRANSMITTED AT THE REQUEST OF THE
GALLATIN NATIONAL FOREST AVALANCHE CENTER.

THE GALLATIN NATIONAL FOREST AVALANCHE CENTER IN BOZEMAN HAS
ISSUED A BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WARNING.

* TIMING...IN EFFECT NOW UNTIL 600 AM MST SATURDAY MORNING.

* AFFECTED AREA...THE LIONHEAD AREA NEAR WEST YELLOWSTONE AND
CENTENNIAL MOUNTAINS IN EASTERN IDAHO.

* AVALANCHE DANGER...THE AVALANCHE DANGER FOR THE WARNING AREA
WILL RISE TO HIGH TODAY.

* REASON/IMPACTS...RECENT HEAVY SNOW COMBINED WITH WIND WILL
RESULT IN WIDESPREAD AVALANCHES. BOTH HUMAN TRIGGERED AND
NATURAL AVALANCHES ARE LIKELY ON SLOPES STEEPER THAN 30
DEGREES.
properties.instruction:
VERY DANGEROUS AVALANCHE CONDITIONS. TRAVEL IN AVALANCHE TERRAIN
IS NOT RECOMMENDED. AVALANCHES MAY RUN LONG DISTANCES AND CAN RUN
INTO MATURE FORESTS, VALLEY FLOORS, OR FLAT TERRAIN.

CONSULT WWW.MTAVALANCHE.COM/FORECAST/CENTENNIALS FOR MORE
DETAILED INFORMATION.

SIMILAR AVALANCHE DANGER MAY EXIST AT LOCATIONS OUTSIDE THE
COVERAGE AREA OF THIS OR ANY AVALANCHE CENTER.

CONSULT HTTP://WWW.MTAVALANCHE.COM OR WWW.AVALANCHE.ORG FOR MORE
DETAILED INFORMATION.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION..
THIS WARNING DOES NOT APPLY TO SKI AREAS WHERE AVALANCHE
MITIGATION MEASURES ARE PERFORMED.
